source_sentence: 佛說嗟韈曩法天子受三歸依獲
translation: the Buddha taught contempt for the three refugee rewards received by the sons of Nāgasena

source_sentence: 免惡道經
translation: Sutra on Immunity from the Evil Path

source_sentence: 西天中印度摩伽陀國那爛陀寺三藏
translation: Tripiṭaka of the Nālandā Temple, Magadha, Central India, Western Heaven

source_sentence: 傳教大師賜紫沙門臣法天奉　詔譯
translation: Translated by imperial order of the purple monk, Minister Fetian, who was granted the title of Master of the Transmission of the Teachings

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時世尊在舍衛國，祇樹林給孤獨園，與大苾芻眾俱。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Bhagavān was in Śrāvastī at Anāthapiṇḍada's Park in Jeta's Grove with a great congregation of monks.

source_sentence: 是時有一天子，名嗟襪曩法，天報將盡，唯餘七日，而乃先現五衰之相，身無威德，垢穢旋生，頭上花鬘，咸悉萎萃，諸身分中臭氣而出，兩腋之下悉皆汗流。
translation: At the time, there was a celestial named Sugatacetana Dharma who was about to reach the end of his heavenly retribution with only seven days left when he first showed signs of five declines, his body was devoid of dignity, dirt and defilement proliferated, the flowers on his head all withered and gathered, odors came out of his bodies, and sweat ran down from his armpits.

source_sentence: 時嗟襪曩法由是之故，不樂本座，宛轉於地，悲哀啼泣，而作是言：「苦哉！
translation: As a result of this, he became unhappy in his seat, wandered around on the ground, lamented, and wept, saying, "What a pain!

source_sentence: 苦哉！
translation: What suffering!

source_sentence: 曼那吉爾池；苦哉！
translation: Lake Mannakil; what a pain!

source_sentence: 苦哉！
translation: What suffering!

source_sentence: 洗浴之池；苦哉！
translation: A pool for bathing; what a pain!

source_sentence: 苦哉！
translation: What suffering!

source_sentence: 寶車與麁惡歡喜雜林等，如是諸園苑，不復更遊戲；苦哉！
translation: "Such parks and gardens as these, such as the jeweled chariot and the mixed woods of debilitating hindrances and pleasures, are no longer to be enjoyed; how painful!

source_sentence: 苦哉！
translation: What suffering!

source_sentence: 跛里耶多羅迦花，永不採摘，雜寶柔軟之地，永不履踐；苦哉！
translation: Never pluck the flower of the lumbar yatra, never tread on the soft and precious ground; how painful!

source_sentence: 苦哉！
translation: What suffering!

source_sentence: 天眾妓女端嚴殊妙，常所侍衛，今相捨離。」
translation: The crowds of celestial prostitutes are beautiful and magnificent, and they've always been guarded by them; now they've abandoned each other."

source_sentence: 是時有餘天子，見斯事已，往帝釋所，白言：「天主！
translation: After seeing this, some other gods went to Śākyamuni and said, "Lord!

source_sentence: 彼嗟襪曩法，五衰現前，命餘七日，宛轉在地，悲哀啼泣。
translation: They sigh in disgust at an ancient teaching, and when the five decayers appear, they spend the remaining seven days of their life writhing on the ground, lamenting and wailing.

source_sentence: 作如是言：『苦哉！
translation: They say, 'Oh, this is painful!'

source_sentence: 苦哉！
translation: What suffering!

source_sentence: 曼那吉爾，洗浴等池；苦哉！
translation: Mannakil, bathing pools, etc.; what a pain!

source_sentence: 苦哉！
translation: What suffering!

source_sentence: 寶車及麁惡歡喜雜林等，如是諸園苑，不復更遊戲；苦哉！
translation: "Such parks and gardens as these, such as the jeweled chariot and the debilitating, joyous, and mixed forests, are no longer to be enjoyed; how painful!

source_sentence: 苦哉！
translation: What suffering!

source_sentence: 跛里耶多羅迦花，永不採摘，雜寶柔軟之地，永不履踐；苦哉！
translation: Never pluck the flower of the lumbar yatra, never tread on the soft and precious ground; how painful!

source_sentence: 苦哉！
translation: What suffering!

source_sentence: 天眾妓女，端嚴殊妙，常所侍衛，今相捨離。』
translation: 'The gods are full of noble and wonderful prostitutes who are always in attendance and who are now abandoned.'

source_sentence: 天主，我見是已，心甚傷切，故來告白。」
translation: Lord of the gods, I was so distressed when I saw that, I came to tell you."

source_sentence: 爾時帝釋天主，心悲愍故，往嗟韈曩法所，而告之言：「天子！
translation: Then, out of pity, Lord Indra went to the former Dharma hall in contempt and told him, "Son of the gods!

source_sentence: 云何而汝賢者宛轉於地，悲哀啼泣，說諸苦事，傷動見者？」
translation: How is it that you, good man, wander about on the ground, lamenting and weeping, speaking of various painful things that disturb those who see them?"

source_sentence: 時嗟襪曩法，忽聞是語，從地而起，整服肅容，合掌而立，白帝釋言：「天主！
translation: When he suddenly heard these words, he rose from the ground, adjusted his robes and appearance, put his palms together, and stood up, saying to Śakra, "Lord of the gods!

source_sentence: 我今壽命唯餘七日。
translation: I now have only seven more days to live.

source_sentence: 命終之後，墮閻浮提王舍大城，以宿業故而受猪身。
translation: When my life ends, I'll fall into the great city of Jambudvīpa and receive the body of a pig because of my past actions.

source_sentence: 天主，既受彼身，於多年中，食噉糞穢，我觀此苦，是故愁憂。」
translation: Having been given that body, Lord of the gods, I've spent years eating dung and filth, and I've observed this suffering, which is why I'm sad."

source_sentence: 爾時帝釋天主，聞是語已，心甚悲愍，告嗟襪曩法天子言：「賢者，汝可誠心歸命三寶。
translation: After hearing these words, Lord Indra was deeply compassionate and addressed the god Siṃhara, saying, "Good man, you may sincerely venerate the Three Treasures.

source_sentence: 應作是言：『歸依佛兩足尊，歸依法離欲尊，歸依僧眾中尊。』」
translation: You should say this, 'Give refuge to the Buddha, the Two Legged One; give refuge to the Dharma, the One who is free of desire; and give refuge to the saṃgha, the one who is honored among the members of the saṃgha.'"

source_sentence: 時彼嗟襪曩法天子，以死怖故，畏傍生故，白帝釋言：「憍尸迦！
translation: Then, the goddess Contemplation Socks formerly known as Dharma said to Śākyamuni, out of fear of death and fear of nearby life, "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 我今歸依佛兩足尊，歸依法離欲尊，歸依僧眾中尊。」
translation: Now, I take refuge in the Buddha, who is honored with two legs, in the Dharma, who is honored without desire, and in the saṃgha."

source_sentence: 時彼天子，受三歸已，心不間斷，以至命終。
translation: After he received the three refugees, that celestial didn't stop his mind until the end of his life.

source_sentence: 諸天之法，下智有見，不能觀上。
translation: The celestials have inferior knowledge and views of the Dharma, but they can't look up.

source_sentence: 時帝釋天主，觀彼天子，生於何處，為生南閻浮提王舍大城受猪身耶？
translation: Did Lord Indra then observe where that celestial son was born, or was he born in the great city of Rājagṛha in South Jambudvī and received the body of a pig?

source_sentence: 為不受猪身？
translation: Why not accept the body of a pig?

source_sentence: 盡彼天眼，觀之不見。
translation: "As far as they can see, the divine eye doesn't see them.

source_sentence: 又觀傍生鬼界，亦復不見；又觀娑訶世界人間，亦復不見；乃至四大王眾天，及忉利天，盡彼觀察，都不能見。
translation: He also looked at the realm of ghosts in the evening life and couldn't see them, and he looked at the human realm in the sahā world and couldn't see them, even to the four great kings of heaven and the Heaven of Thirty-three, which couldn't see them despite his thorough examination.

source_sentence: 爾時帝釋天主，既不見已，心生疑慮。
translation: After not seeing them, Lord Indra then had doubts in his mind.

source_sentence: 於是帝釋往祇樹林，詣世尊所，頂禮佛足，退坐一面，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: So Śakra went to the Bhagavān in the Jetavana Grove, bowed his head at the Buddha's feet, withdrew to sit at one side, and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 彼嗟襪曩法天子，五衰現前，命在七日，宛轉在地，悲哀啼泣，說諸苦事，傷動見者。
translation: "They sigh with contempt for a former celestial who was manifested by five signs of decay and whose life spanned seven days, and who was tossed about on the ground, lamenting and wailing, and describing various painful events that disturbed those who saw him.

source_sentence: 我時到彼，見此事已，而問之言：『云何賢者，悲啼懊惱，憔悴若此？』
translation: When I arrived there and saw this, I asked him, 'Good man, why are you so desolate and distressed?'

source_sentence: 時嗟襪曩法，而告我言：『我今壽命，唯餘七日。
translation: He was contemptuous of the former teaching and told me, 'Now, I have only seven more days to live.

source_sentence: 命終之後，墮閻浮提，生王舍城，而受猪身，於多年中以諸糞穢而為食噉。』
translation: When my life ends, I'll fall into Jambudvīpa and be born in Rājagṛha, where I'll be born as a pig and eat filth for years.'

source_sentence: 我聞此說，心極悲愍，乃告之言：『今汝賢者，欲脫斯苦，當歸命三寶。
translation: When I heard that, I felt compassion for him and told him, 'Now, you good man, if you want to escape this kind of suffering, you must give your life to the Three Treasures.'

source_sentence: 作如是言：「歸依佛兩足尊，歸依法離欲尊，歸依僧眾中尊。」』
translation: Say thus, 'Give refuge to the Buddha, the honored one who has two legs, to the honored one who is free of desire according to the Dharma, and to the honored one among the saṃgha.'

source_sentence: 時嗟襪曩法，以死怖故，畏傍生故，而白我言：『我今歸依佛兩足尊，歸依法離欲尊，歸依僧眾中尊。』
translation: Contemplating the former Dharma, he said to me out of fear of death and of the possibility of taking another life, 'Now, I take refuge in the Buddha, who is two-legged, in the Dharma, who is free from desire, and in the Saṃgha, who is among the honored ones.'

source_sentence: 時嗟襪曩法，受三歸竟，而後命終。
translation: After contemplating that former Dharma, he accepted the three refuges and then died.

source_sentence: 世尊，我今不知，彼嗟襪曩法，託生何處？」
translation: Bhagavān, now I don't know where that man who was contemptuous of the Dharma in his stockings was reborn."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，以正遍知，告帝釋言：「憍尸迦！
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān, with correct omniscience, addressed Tissa, saying, "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 今嗟襪曩法天子，已生覩史多天，受五欲樂。」
translation: Now, I sigh in admiration for the former celestial son who was born in the Tushita Heaven and experienced the five desires and pleasures."

source_sentence: 爾時帝釋天主，聞佛語已，歡喜踊躍，心意快然，諸根圓滿。
translation: After hearing the Buddha's words, the lord of Indra rejoiced and jumped for joy, his mind was refreshed, and his faculties were perfected.

source_sentence: 即於佛前，說伽陀曰：「若歸依於佛，　　彼不墮惡道，　棄捨人身已，　　當獲得天身；　若歸依於法，　　彼不墮惡道，　棄捨人身已，　　當獲得天身；　若歸依於僧，　　彼不墮惡道，　棄捨人身已，　　當獲得天身。」
translation: He then spoke to the Buddha and said, "If someone puts their trust in the Buddha, they won't fall into a bad path, and after renouncing their person, they'll attain the body of a god; if someone puts their trust in the Dharma, they won't fall into a bad path, and after renouncing their person, they'll attain the body of a god; if someone puts their trust in the saṃgha, they won't fall into a bad path, and after renouncing their person, they'll attain the body of a god."

source_sentence: 復說伽陀曰：「誠心歸命佛，　　彼人當所得，　若晝若夜中，　　佛心常憶念；　誠心歸命法，　　彼人當所得，　若晝若夜中，　　法力常加持；　誠心歸命僧，　　彼人當所得，　若晝若夜中，　　僧威常覆護。」
translation: Again, he said the Gadhātu, "With sincere faith in the Buddha, that person will attain, whether by day or night, the Buddha's mind will always remember; with sincere faith in the Dharma, that person will attain, whether by day or night, the power of the Dharma will always uphold; with sincere faith in the saṃgha, that person will attain, whether by day or night, the authority of the saṃgha will always protect them."

source_sentence: 爾時帝釋天主說伽陀已，世尊印言：「如是如是。
translation: After Lord Indra then spoke about the khadhas, the Bhagavān sealed, "So it is.

source_sentence: 「歸命佛法僧，　　定不墮惡道；　棄捨人身已，　　當獲得天身。」
translation: 'By turning their backs on the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṃgha, they certainly won't fall into a bad path; after renouncing their person, they'll attain the body of a celestial.'"

source_sentence: 爾時世尊說伽陀曰：「若佛陀二字，　　得到於舌上，　同彼歸命等，　　不虛過一生；　若達磨二字，　　得到於舌上，　同彼歸命等，　　不虛過一生；　若僧伽二字，　　得到於舌上，　同彼歸命等，　　不虛過一生。」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān spoke the jātaka, saying, "If the word Buddha were to be placed on the tongue, it would be the same as their returning to life and so forth and wouldn't be in vain for a lifetime; if the word dharma were to be placed on the tongue, it would be the same as their returning to life and so forth and wouldn't be in vain for a lifetime; and if the word saṃgha were to be placed on the tongue, it would be the same as their returning to life and so forth and wouldn't be in vain for a lifetime."

source_sentence: 又說偈言：「佛法僧名若不知，　　彼人最下故不獲，　輪迴宛轉而久處，　　如迦尸花住虛空。」
translation: He also spoke a verse, "If you don't know the names of buddhas, dharmas, and saṃgha, they're the lowest of the low and therefore aren't attained, turning and wandering for a long time, like the Kāśyapa flower standing in space."

source_sentence: 佛說是經已，諸苾芻眾，天帝釋等，一切大眾，歡喜信受，作禮而退。
translation: After the Buddha spoke this sūtra, the multitude of monks, gods, goddesses, and other people rejoiced and believed it, paid homage, and withdrew.

source_sentence: 佛說嗟襪曩法天子受三歸獲免惡道經
translation: The Buddha taught the Sutra of Contemplating the Sutra of the Son of Dharma Accepting the Three Refuges and Being Freed from a Bad Path.
